item.title: Cookie Run Kingdom - Best Support Cookies
item.description:
Support Cookies are a popular Cookie type found in Cookie Run: Kingdom , as there are more than twenty Cookies in the game that fall under this category. Support Cookies are a versatile part of any team composition in both PvP and PvE modes, acting as a bridge between the Magic type and Healing type Cookies. They can heal, but can also provide buffs, remove debuffs, and target enemies with debuffs. Some of them can even attack enemies with their skills.

As there are so many Support Cookies to choose from in Cookie Run: Kingdom , we’re going to be looking at eight particularly noteworthy choices to help players decide who they want to add to their team.

Cream Puff Cookie

Wannabe Witch

  • Epic Cookie
  • Special Skill: Jellius Extremus!/ Extra Cream
  • Korean VA: Lee Da-eun (이다은)
  • English VA: Cassandra Lee Morris

Cream Puff Cookie's skills revolve around using her budding magic abilities to protect her allies, heal and buff the team. She has a regular skill that focuses on healing and causing area damage. When active, the skill creates a tornado made of Jellie candies that restores the team’s health and causes area Light damage.

When her Extra Cream Magic Candy skill is active, Cream Puff Cookie learns to buff her team, granting increased attack buffs, Stun immunity, and increasing critical chance. She’ll also start stacking up her Cream Buff skill, which increases her own damage resistance and makes her stronger.

The Seven BTS Cookies (RM Cookie, Jin Cookie, SUGA Cookie, J-Hope Cookie, Jimin Cookie, V Cookie, and Jung Kook Cookie)

Global Superstars

  • Special Cookies
  • Special Skill: ARMY’s Wishes (this is the same for all seven Cookies)
  • Universal VA's:
  • RM Cookie: Kim Nam-joon [김남준]/ RM of BTS.
  • Jin Cookie: Kim Seok-jin [김석진]/ Jin of BTS.
  • SUGA Cookie: Min Yoon-gi [민윤기]/ SUGA of BTS
  • J-Hope Cookie: Jung Ho-seok [정호석]/ J-Hope of BTS
  • Jimin Cookie: Park Ji-min [박지민]/ Jimin of BTS
  • V Cookie: Kim Tae-hyung [김태형]/ V of BTS
  • Jung Kook Cookie: Jeon Jung-kook [전정국]/ Jung Kook of BTS

We’re putting seven Cookies into one next as the BTS Cookies all have the same skill, so players can use any of them within their team to the same effect. These Cookies were released as part of a special collaboration between Cookie Run: Kingdom and the popular South Korean boy band BTS. Unfortunately, the Cookies-based on each of the seven members of the band- could only be obtained in the limited-time Braver Together Gacha, so they are no longer available.

If players do have at least one of the BTS Cookies, they make for useful Support types due to their ARMY’s Wishes skill. The skill Safeguards the BTS Cookies, so they can’t take damage. It also provides a Stun immunity buff, heals allies, and makes the team resistant to debuffs. If a teammate gets hit with three or more debuffs, ARMY’s Wishes creates an HP shield for the whole team. The BTS Cookies are a must for fans of BTS, but they also make for great Supports.

Silverbell Cookie

Pretty Melody

  • Epic Cookie
  • Special Skill: Gleeful Chime
  • Korean VA: Seo Da-hye (서다혜)
  • English VA: McKenzie Atwood

Silverbell Cookie’s bow and arrow weapon might fool players into thinking he is a Ranged type, but he is a Support Cookie through and through. When his Gleeful Chime skill is active, Silverbell Cookie summons Silverbell flowers that bloom around the team and heal them periodically. Those healed get a bonus to the amount that they are healed if they have multiple active buffs. The flowers also give allies a damage resistance buff.

Silverbell Cookie inflicts some damage via his Silverbell flowers with their Silverbell Pollen. This debuff does damage periodically and when it ends, the final hit will apply the Stun debuff and do area damage. Silverbell Cookie is also immune to Mushroom Mutation and Spore Dispersal effects, making him a useful ally in battles where these debuffs are in effect. He also works well with Mercurial Knight Cookie, as when the two are in battle together, they will receive the Silver Knighthood effect, which increases their attack speed and maximum health points. Elder Faerie Cookie and White Lily Cookie will also receive buffs if they are on the same team.

Frilled Jellyfish Cookie

Deep Sea Beauty

  • Epic Cookie
  • Special Skill: Frilled Snare
  • Korean VA: Lee Bo-hee (이보희)
  • English VA: Jessie Gill

Next up is a merperson Cookie whose skills enable her to debuff and trap enemies with ease. Frilled Jellyfish Cookie uses her Frilled Snare to ensnare the enemy team with her tentacles (though she can only ensnare up to five enemies and will always target Cookies first). As well as trapping enemies, her tentacles reduce their movement speed, deal Sea Foam damage, increase the amount of Water-type damage they take, and give them the Zap debuff.

Frilled Jellyfish Cookie also protects herself by burrowing underground, creating a damage resistance buff for herself. Any changes in attack speed won’t affect her when she does this, and if she falls in battle, she will turn herself into several small jellyfish which heal the team. Frilled Jellyfish Cookie is a great choice of a damaging Support character that can debuff the enemy significantly and protect herself and the team while doing so.

Linzer Cookie

Elegant Novelist

  • Epic Cookie
  • Special Skill: The Culprit…is YOU!
  • Korean VA: Lee Seul (이슬)
  • English VA: Dawn M. Bennett

Next is a Cookie who is not only an excellent Support character, but also a novelist who uses her skills as a writer for her special skill. When her special skill is active, Linzer Cookie uses her Deduction abilities learned from her mystery novel writing. She starts earning Deduction stacks, and these stacks increase the critical percentage chance for her teammates. They also inflict the Suspect debuff on the enemy with the highest attack. The Suspect will receive extra damage and area damage will hurt enemies close by.

As Linzer Cookie’s Deduction stacks up, the Suspect debuff will become more powerful. If Deduction stacks to the maximum amount of seven, another defense lowering debuff will apply to the Suspect. Allies will also receive a critical damage buff at maximum Deduction stacks. Linzer Cookie is the best choice of a Support type for those looking for a Cookie that can apply massive debuffs and heighten the skills of the team at the same time.

Peach Blossom Cookie

Sweet and Fruity

  • Epic Cookie
  • Special Skill: Heavenly Fruit
  • Korean VA: Yu Son-il (유선일)
  • English VA: Charlie Thurston

The sweet and peachy Peach Blossom Cookie is a Support Cookie that offers heals, buffs, and even a bit of damage to the enemy team with his skills. When using his Heavenly Fruit ability, Peach Blossom Cookie summons a healing Peach Tree. The Peach Tree heals the team and does extra healing for whoever has the lowest health, but it also creates Peach Bao fruits. The Peach Bao’s buff the team, offering resistance to enemy debuffs and damage resistance.

Peach Blossom Cookie’s damage comes from his Unripe Peach Bao fruits that also fall from his tree. He attacks the enemy with Unripe Peach Baos, debuffing them by reducing their movement and attack speed and causing damage. Peach Blossom Cookie can also protect himself from the Apathy debuff thanks to his Peach Fragrance.

Snapdragon Cookie

Cute Dragon Baby

  • Special Cookie
  • Special Skill: Arcane Blossom
  • Korean VA: Kang Sae-bom (강새봄)
  • English VA: Lana McKissack

Much like Peach Blossom Cookie, Snapdragon Cookie is all about combining healing with buffs for teammates (and being super cute while doing so). They also have the same Safeguard immunity that the BTS Cookies have, meaning that Snapdragon Cookie can’t be harmed or attacked.

Snapdragon Cookie uses Arcane Blossom to heal the team and buff them with blooming snapdragon flowers. The buffs that Snapdragon Cookie gives their allies make them resistant to Stun, increase their resistance to damage and debuffs, and increase their attack. Not only that, but the team will also get an HP shield and have their maximum health increased due to Snapdragon Cookies Draconic Lifeforce passive skill. Despite not having any offensive abilities, Snapdragon Cookie is an awesome Support that can heal effectively and buff the team, making them a force to be reckoned with.

Cream Ferret Cookie

Ferret Bestie

  • Special Cookie
  • Special Skill: Snuggly Ferret
  • Korean VA: Lee Ju-eun (이주은)
  • English VA: Kaitlyn Robrock

Last but not least is Cream Ferret Cookie, a healer and buffing Support type that manages to earn the top spot on our list thanks to having three separate elements to their Snuggly Ferret special skill. When initially using the skill, Cream Ferret Cookie turns into ferret form and heals the whole team for 55% of their attack immediately while also offering periodic healing. Cream Ferret Cookie’s allies also receive critical damage, critical chance, and damage resistance buffs.

The next part of Cream Ferret Cookie’s special revolves around them jumping onto the back of the teammate with the highest attack and giving them a buff called Fuzzy Scarf. This buff gives the ally increased attack, even more critical damage, and more resistance to debuffs. The recipient of Fuzzy Scarf will also receive more healing and Cream Ferret Cookie will gain resistance to debuffs.

The final part of the Snuggly Ferret skill is Precious Friend, wherein Cream Ferret Cookie goes to the teammate whose health is at a certain level and creates an HP shield for them while recovering their attack. They will also grant this ally the Fuzzy Scarf buff too. Cream Ferret Cookie is one of the best Supports found in Cookie Run: Kingdom as they not only support the whole team but also hone in on certain teammates to give them additional buffs and support.

item.title: Meta Quest 3 Update Notes Reveal Significant Improvements
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Meta Quest update improves latency, contrast, and resolution, enhancing the overall visual and immersive experience for users.
  • The new Layout app allows users to measure spaces, visualize furniture, and check alignment, offering practical and innovative features.
  • The Meta Quest 3 features upgraded graphics, enhanced Touch Controller pairing, and an audio reminder for low battery, adding convenience and seamless functionality.

The Meta Quest v68 update is rolling out to headsets, and it includes significant improvements to latency, contrast, screenshots, and more. Fans should expect the update to arrive in the days to come, as Meta rolls out updates in waves, rather than upgrading all Meta Quest headsets at the exact same time.

Although some VR enthusiasts are already looking forward to the Meta Quest 4, the Meta Quest 3 is currently the company's flagship consumer-level virtual reality headset. The portable and tether-free nature of the Quest has appealed to fans, though due to relying on onboard hardware, the Quest 3 has some drawbacks in comparison to its tethered, PC-dependent competitors. However, each update tends to improve upon the Quest headsets' capabilities in some way, and v68 is no exception.

Meta has revealed that the v68 update is rolling out to Meta Quest 3 headsets right now. The update adds a number of features and improves upon old ones. For example, the resolution of screenshots has been upgraded dramatically from 1400x1400 pixels to 2160x2160. The Meta Quest 3 update also adds improved latency, reducing the number of stutters and frame rate drops on the units. Content Adaptive Brightness Control has also been added in the device's Experimental Mode, giving users reduced contrast when scenes are particularly dark, improving visual clarity.

Meta Quests have received improved graphics performance, with smoother experiences in both virtual reality and mixed reality. Touch Controllers can now be paired through the headset rather than through the app, and the keyboard will spawn in a "more optimal position," without overlapping other windows. The headsets will also make a beeping sound when taken off if the battery is running low, as a reminder to charge it.

The most interesting addition to the devices may be the new Layout app. This system allows users to tap the mixed reality capabilities of the Meta Quest 3, allowing them to do things like measure the square footage of a room, or visualize what a large piece of furniture or a TV might look like in the space available to them. It even allows users to determine if things like wall-mounted televisions are level. This app could prove quite useful when shopping online, which may be part of Meta's plans for it.

In all, this update should make for a more pleasant and seamless experience for Meta Quest 3 fans. With no announcements made yet on when the next Meta Quest will launch, making the most of the current hardware is a wise choice.

Meta Quest v68 Update Patch Notes

These features and enhancements will become available starting the week of July 29, 2024 and will be pushed to Meta Quest 3, Meta Quest Pro and Meta Quest 2 headsets.

The Meta Quest mobile app is now the Meta Horizon mobile app

We’ve updated the look and feel of the app, added a new Light Mode, and made it easier to socialize and express yourself, even when you’re not in the headset. Jump into worlds, find your next favorite mixed reality experience, customize your avatar and manage your headset, all from your phone.

We’ve also added the ability to start or join audio calls between the app and Meta Quest headsets, so you can chat with friends anytime regardless of which device they’re on.

Meta AI on Meta Quest

Meta AI on Quest is a new AI-powered assistant that enables you to seamlessly access information, get insights about your real life surroundings, and control your device using voice. Meta AI on Meta Quest will launch as an experimental feature.

Meta Quest: Play now, pay later

Get Meta Quest 3 with access to a revolving catalog of games you can play instantly and enhanced warranty coverage starting at $24.99 per month over 24 months at 0% APR. You can check out this offer at meta.com/quest/play-now-pay-later.

Graphics and performance improvements (Quest 3 only)

We’ve made a number of enhancements to Quest 3 graphics and performance.

  • We reduced performance latency for a more immersive, comfortable and lifelike experience.
  • Quest 3 now supports Content Adaptive Brightness Control, which reduces contrast in darker scenes, improving the display experience.
    • You can turn on this feature from Experimental in Settings .

Safety Center updates

Experience streamlined account management and clearer communication about your profile's status and any reported issues from the Meta Horizon mobile app. These experiences will be consistent with what you can already do in your headset.

Keyboard improvements

We’ve made a number of improvements to the virtual keyboard.

  • When you start a search or chat, the keyboard will appear in a more optimal position and won’t overlap with other screens.
  • You can easily reposition the keyboard in your space, bring it closer or move it to the side.
  • The keyboard will reappear in different default locations based on what you were last doing and where you last positioned it.

Layout utility app

Layout is a new utility app designed to help you spatially measure, align, and visualize real world objects directly in your physical space. Some things you can do with Layout include:

  • Measure the square footage of your living room.
  • Visualize the size and placement of a 72” TV on the wall.
  • Visualize potential new furniture in your living room.
  • Measure the height and depth of a kitchen counter.
  • Align the photo frames on your wall.

You can find Layout in your Library.

Library improvements

We’ve made a number of enhancements to your Library and the app downloading experience.

  • Manage all your downloads and app updates from the new Download tab in your Library. See what apps are in queue and prioritize apps you want to download first.
  • We’ve also added a new All tab to your Library which shows all your apps and worlds in a single page.

Improved graphics performance

You should now see smoother and more responsive virtual and mixed reality experiences on Meta Quest headsets with fewer delays and interruptions.

Low battery alert

You’ll now receive an audio alert from your headset when you take it off and your battery is low as a reminder to charge it up before your next session.

Cloud backup management

You can now manage your cloud backups for apps. Find out which of your apps are backed up, when they were last backed up, and start a backup by going to System in Settings and selecting Backup .

  • This will be rolling out gradually.

Controller pairing now in headset

Previously, you could only pair a controller to your headset using the Meta Horizon mobile app. You can now pair a controller in your headset from by going to Settings , then Devices , then Controllers and selecting Pair controllers .

Audio input balance

You can now control the audio level balance between your microphone and game audio when recording, live streaming, or casting. You can update these settings by going to Settings , then System and selecting Camera .

Screenshot resolution improvement (Quest 3 only)

Now your screenshots taken on Quest 3 will look even better as we've increased the resolution from 1440x1440 to 2160x2160.

item.title: One of 2024's Highest-Rated New Game Releases Can Now Run Doom
item.description:
Highlights

  • A gamer gets Doom running in Balatro, sharing the results on Reddit.
  • The meme of running Doom on various platforms has been alive for a long time.
  • Gamers are excited to see what the gamer will do next after successfully modding Doom into Balatro.

A gamer has found a way to run Doom in Balatro . Balatro is one of 2024's smash-hit gaming success stories. Riffing off the main concepts of poker, Balatro insists on breaking the accepted rules to succeed. The game was developed in two and a half years by one person known as LocalThunk. Of the many deck-builders that gamers can get their hands on, players love Balatro because it has a simple premise that allows for deep and addictive gameplay.

On top of gamers loving and wanting to see what's next for the Doom franchise, many fans show their appreciation for the iconic original release by running the game on anything in sight. The origin of the meme is largely attributed to a 2006 video that shows Youtuber KevlarGorilla running the game on a Nintendo DS. At this point, the meme of being able to run Doom on something has been alive for nearly as long as the online gaming community itself has.

UwUDev on Reddit shared a video where they run Doom on their copy of Balatro. On a surface level, it seems to make sense that becoming one of 2024's most popular games entails a run-in with one of the biggest gaming memes around. The gameplay here shows Doom creatively running across a spread of cards that were originally all jokers. Although it stutters occasionally, having the game run at all is an impressive feat.

Gamer Mods Doom Into Balatro

Part of this is possible because of just how small Doom is in comparison. While both games are quite small, Doom is approximately 2.4 megabytes compared to Balatro 's 150 megabytes. In their post, UwUDev states that they did not expect to see so many fans enjoy seeing what they achieved. Next, UwUDev says that they plan to do "something even more impressive and stupid." However, "stupid" is not the word that the gamers who have seen this post would use, as many Balatro players acknowledge this as a stroke of genius.

At this point, LocalThunk has seen and shared the post, and excited fans have responded wondering what else Balatro can run. Some gamers have joked, asking if it can run the notoriously graphics-intense Crysis series. Gamers appear to be excited to see what UwUDev does next. Whether it is still some fusion of Balatro and Doom or something entirely new is still unclear, but there seems to be plenty more to come.

item.title: 6 Biggest Dragons In World Of Warcraft, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Magical beasts in World of Warcraft vary in size and power, some important enough to influence Azerothian history.
  • Dragons, such as Malygos, Nefarian, Onyxia, Alexstrasza, and Deathwing, play crucial roles in the lore and quests.
  • Galakrond, the Father of Dragons, was the largest proto-dragon who birthed all other dragons in Azeroth.

There's an interesting variety of magical beasts in World of Warcraft , from the walking shrubs in the woods to massive, magical beasts of impressive size and power. Some of these are just part of the background, but others are recurring NPCs that are important enough to influence the course of Azerothian history.

The dragons of the World of Warcraft have been present since the beginning of time. Some of them have been touched by the Titans and act as Aspects of worldly entities like magic, nature, or even death. In many cases, their size reflects their importance, and some of the largest dragons also happen to be Azeroth's most famous.

6 Malygos

Aspect Of The Blue Dragonflight

  • Location: Various, including open zones like Azshara, the Nexus instance in the Borean Tundra, and the instanced subzone Mind's Eye
  • Status: Dead according to the Lore, can also be killed or defeated

Also known as the Guardian of Magic and Hidden Arcanum, Maylgos is the dragon that most players have seen at least once thanks to his numerous appearances throughout the game world. In Classic versions of the game, he was one of the dragons that players had to find to finish part of the "Sceptre of the Sands" quest that was connected to the Gates of An'Qiraj event, which is what made him famous.

Malygos may not be the biggest dragon, but he's most definitely the smartest, at least that's what he says. His general attitude reflects the pride of the magic-users for whom he serves as guide and guardian. Run the Nexus in Northrend and face him as the final boss to get a realistic idea of his impressive size, and remember: He's one of the small ones.

5 Nefarian

Lord Of Blackrock Spire

  • Location: Blackwing Lair in Classic , also in Blackwing Descent, which was added in Cataclysm
  • Status: Dead in the Lore, a killable boss in two instances

The progression to reach Nefaion , the boss who waits at the end of Blackwing Lair and is considered the lord of the highest part of Blackrock Mountain, is a long and arduous one. It requires an attunement process, rigorous gear checks, and some serious fire-resistance equipment. Hopefully, any players that face him have already faced his younger sister, Onyxia, because they can use some of the same gear to protect them.

The versions of WoW post- Cataclysm have a second dungeon to continue this story called "Blackwing Descent", in which Nefarian teams up with his sister, Onyxia, although she was in undead form by this point. The pair have a lot in common regarding how they secretly worked behind the scenes to undermine their opponents, with Nefarion taking the alter-ego of Lord Victor Nefarious, and Onyxia disguising herself as a Stormwind noble.

4 Onyxia

Broodmother Of The Black Dragonflight

  • Location: Onyxia's Lair in the Swamp or Blackwing Descent in Blackrock Mountain
  • Status: Dead according to the Lore, but a boss in the game

As Lady Katrana Prestor, Onyxia was able to infiltrate the human kingdom at the highest levels for decades, influencing the Stonemasons and Nobles to turn against each other and start a violent rebellion. This conflict led to the untimely death of the queen and further plunged the flagship Alliance members into a state of disarray.

Prestor continued to flex her political muscles as the royal councilor to young Anduin Wynn, and used the Drakefire Amulet to control his guardian, Highlord Bolvar Fordragon. It was also this enchanted amulet that the player has to find to enter her lair.

There are two versions of how Lady Prestor was found out and slain. The older version credits agents of the Horde with discovering her identity, but a newer version credits Varian Wrynn with killing her after returning to Stormwind.

3 Alexstrasza

Aspect Of Life

  • Location: Various, but consistently atop Wyrmrest Temple in Dragonblight
  • Status: Alive and friendly to players of each faction

An example of the eternal feminine that often makes its way into fantasy stories, Alexstrasza is the guardian of all life in Azeroth, and it's a heavy burden to carry. One of her most important roles is her struggle against Deathwing, who was determined to destroy all of creation.

Since the events of Cataclysm , she's passed on most of this responsibility on to the mortal heroes of World of Warcraft, but she still appears constantly in lore and quests. Alexstrasza is depicted in various places throughout the world that she rules, but players can find her elven-version on the top of Wyrmrest Temple in Dragonblight, a zone in Northrend. Ysera, another important Dragon aspect who has close ties to the Night Elves and the Emerald Dream, is her smaller younger sister.

2 Deathwing

Aspect Of Death

  • Location: Various places in Azeroth, often bringing with him a lake of fire that kills anything in its path
  • Status: Dead in the Lore, but a killable enemy in the Cataclysm expansion

In his original form, he was Neltharion, and he was a friend to many of his fellow aspects. He was driven to madness by the influence of the Old Gods, like his friend Malygos, and this former Aspect of Earth became The Aspect of Death.

It was Deathwing's dark, massive visage that blocked out the sun and filled the air with smoke in the events of the Cataclysm expansion. He literally broke the world, changing the geography of the Eastern Kingdoms and Kalimdor, and Azeroth was changed forever. Under his guidance, the Horde was able to imprison Alexstrasza, the one dragon who could stand against him, and the other Dragon Aspects enlisted the help of some brave adventurers to help defeat him and free their mother.

1 Galakrond

Father Of Dragons

  • Location: His remains take up most of the Dragonblight zone in Northrend
  • Status: Officially "non-living" or undead

Galakrond was a proto-dragon, meaning he was untouched by the Titans and not reduced to an Aspect, and it was from him that all other dragons were born. He was bigger than all the other dragon Aspects combined, and when his nature turned from benevolent to hostile, they had to unite and battle against him.

As he was driven deeper into madness, Galakrond consumed other dragons and grew even bigger, sprouting necrotic appendages and vomiting up his prey to become his undead minions. After the Aspects defeated him, he rose from undeath to attack Wyrmrest Temple in the Wrath of the Lich King expansion, only to be defeated again. His massive skeleton rests at the foot of the temple, so anyone can visit and marvel at his massive size.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Wins Award for Their Viridian Forest Ranger Cosplay
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon cosplay allows fans to show their love for the series in creative ways, from dressing up as trainers to cosplaying the Pokemon themselves.
  • The impressive Viridian Forest Ranger cosplay featured an animatronic Pidgey, showcasing the dedication and skill of the fan behind the costume.
  • As Pokemon fans grow older, cosplay and other hobbies celebrating the franchise become more intricate and skillful, showcasing the creativity within the community.

A Pokemon fan has won an award for their Viridian Forest Ranger cosplay. The impressive work utilizes more than just a costume, with the Pokemon fan putting some tremendous effort into creating an animatronic Pidgey to accompany them and complete the look.

Pokemon cosplay is just one of many ways that fans of the series show their love for it. Whether players are costuming as the human characters and trainers or cosplaying the Pokemon themselves, the popular hobby lets fans represent their favorites. Players have been enjoying cosplaying as Pokemon characters since the series first premiered, and it shows no signs of stopping.

Reddit user Worldwarallen has shared their cosplay with fans in the Pokemon subreddit. A photo shows the cosplayer's ranger costume in detail as the fan holds their prize for getting second place at the competition. A Pidgey can be seen sitting on their right arm, which would pull the look together even if it were just a plushie. However, this fan went above and beyond creating this Pidgey, as it's actually an animatronic.

How the Animatronic Pidgey Came to Life

A TikTok video shared by the cosplayer demonstrates how much work went into the Pidgey. Worldwarallen notes that they started working on the Pidgey back in April 2023, though it took a while for them to get it to where they were satisfied. The Pidgey can be seen before and after its body and feathers are applied, with its head swiveling around in a jittery fashion similar to real-world birds. As the player notes in their Reddit post, the handler glove that they wear actually houses the batteries for the popular bird Pokemon. Worldwarallen also went to multiple events in order to work on their puppeteering, adding further polish to the execution.

Fellow fans have been extremely impressed with the cosplay, particularly the special Pidgey. A couple suggested that this fan could appear in a live-action Pokemon movie, while another said that they looked as though they were genuinely an experienced ranger with knowledge of the local animal life. Another congratulated Worldwarallen on the completed build, to which he teased that he's also working on a Charmander, which should be fun to see.

As the years have progressed and many Pokemon fans have become adults, cosplay and other hobbies celebrating Pokemon have become more intricate and skillful. It will be interesting to see what Worldwarallen shares next with the community.
